text: "The Thrill Is Gone" is a 1969 slow minor-key blues song written by West coast blues musician Roy Hawkins and Rick Darnell in 1951. Hawkins' recording of the song reached number six in the Billboard R&B; chart in 1951. In 1970, "The Thrill Is Gone" became a major hit for B.B. King. Afterwards, many blues and other artists have recorded their versions of the song. ==References== Category:1969 songs Category:Blues music Category:B.B. King songs Category:Aretha Franklin songs
title: The Thrill Is Gone
